sentences: Mehed, tulge kirikusse! Kuulake oma hingekarjase sõna!
Kuulake seda häält see on meie pastor kõneleb.
Peaksime kuulama, mida pastor meile ütleb.
context: The word 'kuulake' is the plural imperative form of the verb 'kuulama' in Estonian. It means to listen or pay attention to what someone is saying, particularly referring to listening to a spiritual leader such as a pastor or priest (hingekarjas). In religious contexts, it specifically refers to listening to the words of one's shepherd/pastor.
